title: of the Road Traffic Act 2016 (No. 21 of 2016)) and 41 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic Act 2010 (Part
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Road Traffic Act 2010 (Part 

3) (Fixed Charge Offences) Regulations 2022. 

(2) These Regulations (other than as provided for in paragraph (3)) come 

into operation on 27 October 2022. 

(3) The fixed charge offences mentioned in Items 1 and 2 of Schedule 1 
and at reference number 16 in Item 6 of Schedule 5 come into operation on 1 
January 2023.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited road traffic act 2010 (part 3) (fixed charge offences) regulation 2022 (2) regulation (other provided paragraph (3)) come operation 27 october 2022 (3) fixed charge offence mentioned item 1 2 schedule 1 reference number 16 item 6 schedule 5 come operation 1 january 2023

title: of the Road Traffic Act 2016 (No. 21 of 2016)) and 41 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: In these Regulations —
text_norm: 2 regulation -- act 1968 mean road traffic act 1968 (no 25 1968) act 1994 mean road traffic act 1994 (no 7 1994) act 2006 mean road traffic act 2006 (no 23 2006) act 2010 mean road traffic act 2010 (no 25 2010) no 2 act 2011 mean road traffic (no 2) act 2011 (no 28 2011) principal act mean road traffic act 1961 (no 24 1961) regulation 1997 mean road traffic (traffic parking) regulation 1997 (s.i no 182 1997) regulation 2012 mean road traffic (traffic parking (amendment) (no 2) regulation 2012) (s.i no 332 2012)

title: of the Road Traffic Act 2016 (No. 21 of 2016)) and 41 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: 3. Each of the offences under the Road Traffic Acts 1961 to 2022
text_raw:
3. Each of the offences under the Road Traffic Acts 1961 to 2022 
mentioned in Schedules 1 to 7 (other than in Part 2 of Schedule 4 or Part 2 of 
Schedule 6) is declared to be a fixed charge offence. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 21st October, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [526] 3
text_norm: 3 offence road traffic act 1961 2022 mentioned schedule 1 7 (other part 2 schedule 4 part 2 schedule 6) declared fixed charge offence notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 21st october 2022 526 3

title: of the Road Traffic Act 2016 (No. 21 of 2016)) and 41 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: 4. The prescribed amount of a fixed charge —
text_raw:
4. The prescribed amount of a fixed charge — 

(a) 

in respect of an offence mentioned in Schedule 1, is €200, 

(b) 

in respect of an offence mentioned in Schedule 2, is €160, 

(c) 

in respect of an offence mentioned in Schedule 3, is €150, 

(d) 

in respect of an offence mentioned in Schedule 4, is €120, 

(e) 

(f) 

in respect of an offence mentioned in Schedule 5, is €80, 

in respect of an offence mentioned in Schedule 6, is €60, and 

(g) 

in respect of an offence mentioned in Schedule 7, is €40.
text_norm: 4 prescribed amount fixed charge -- (a) respect offence mentioned schedule 1 eur200 (b) respect offence mentioned schedule 2 eur160 (c) respect offence mentioned schedule 3 eur150 (d) respect offence mentioned schedule 4 eur120 (e) (f) respect offence mentioned schedule 5 eur80 respect offence mentioned schedule 6 eur60 (g) respect offence mentioned schedule 7 eur40

 4 [526] 

Regulation 3 and 4(a) 

Schedule 1 

€200 fixed charge 

Traffic and parking offences – Act of 1994 and exceeding permitted weight 

Item 1 

An offence under section 35(5) of the Act of 1994 consisting of a 
contravention of Regulation 3 of the Road Traffic (Parking in Disabled 
Person's Parking Bay) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 427 of 2022) by a person 
who is not the holder of a disabled person's parking permit parking a vehicle in 
a disabled person's parking bay not for the convenience of the person to whom 
the permit was granted. 

Item 2 

An offence under section 35(5) of the Act of 1994 consisting of a 
contravention of Regulation 4 of the Road Traffic (Control of Traffic) 
Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 638 of 2006) by the driver of a prohibited vehicle. 

Item 3 

An offence under section 12 (as amended by section 18 of the Act of 2006) of 
the Principal Act consisting of using on a public road a vehicle — 

(a) whose weight unladen exceeds maximum permitted weight, 

(b) whose weight laden exceeds maximum permitted weight, or 

(c) 

any part of which transmits to ground greater weight than 
maximum permitted weight, specified in the Road Traffic 
(Construction and Use of Vehicles) Regulations 2003 (S.I. No. 5 
of 2003).

Principal Act consisting of a contravention of Regulation 17(6)(b)(iv) of the 
Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006) 
by a learner permit holder driving a vehicle unaccompanied by a qualified 
person.

€150 fixed charge 

Offence under Act of 1994 

An offence under section 35(5) of the Act of 1994 consisting of a 
contravention of article 44(1) of the Regulations of 1997 by stopping or 
parking a vehicle in a disabled person’s parking bay without a disabled 
person’s parking permit. 

Regulation 3 and 4(d) 

Schedule 4 

€120 fixed charge 

Part 1 

Driving offences under Road Traffic Acts 

Item 1 

An offence under section 35(5) of the Act of 1994 consisting of a 
contravention of article 10(1)(a) of the Regulations of 1997 by overtaking a 
pedal cyclist in the circumstances prohibited. 

Item 2 

An offence under section 42 (inserted by section 10 of the Act of 2006) of the 
Principal Act consisting of a contravention of Regulation 17(6)(b)(iii) (inserted 
by Regulation 2(b) of the Road Traffic (Licensing of Learner Drivers) 
Regulations 2007 (S.I. No. 719 of 2007)) of the Road Traffic (Licensing of 
Drivers) Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006) by a learner permit holder 
failing to display an L-plate or tabard while driving. 

An offence under section 3(3) of the Act of 2006 consisting of holding a 
mobile phone while driving. 

Item 3 

An offence under section 4(2) of the Act of 2014 consisting of a failure by a 
novice driver to display an N-plate or tabard when driving in a public place.

Item 1 

An offence under section 11(5) of the Principal Act consisting of a 
contravention of Regulation 29 (as amended by Regulation 4 of the Road 
Traffic (Lighting of Vehicles) (Amendment) Regulations 2009 (S.I. No. 487 of 
2009)) of the Road Traffic (Lighting of Vehicles) Regulations 1963 (S.I. No. 
189 of 1963) by riding or wheeling a pedal cycle without a front lamp or rear 
lamp lit during lighting-up hours. 

Item 2

of the Principal Act consisting of driving a pedal cycle in a public place 
without reasonable consideration for other persons using the place.

title: of the Road Traffic Act 2016 (No. 21 of 2016)) and 41 of the Road Traffic Act
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations specify which offences involving the driving or use of 
mechanically propelled vehicles and pedal cycles are fixed charge offences for 
the purposes of section 34 of the Road Traffic Act 2010 (No. 25 of 2010) and 
determine the amount of the fixed charge for each offence. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [526] 23 

BAILE ÁTHA CLIATH 
ARNA FHOILSIÚ AG OIFIG AN tSOLÁTHAIR
